answers.answer: Well, it's possible you have low blood pressure, but the doc should have checked that right off the bat, with the cuff they put on your arm.  Next time you're in a pharmacy, see if they've got one of those machines where you sit down and take your own pressure.  It's supposed to be about 120/80, so if it's say 100/60, well, I'd sure bring that up to the doc next time you see them.  Also, could be you're not getting enough protein, which the bloodwork should show that when it comes back, and you yourself ought to know that, you know, eating eggs and hamburgers, stuff like that.  I don't know if you're a boy or girl, but female problems can cause that dizzy feeling, too, because of a deficiency in iron.  By the way, a CT scan is no big deal at all, very commonly used, but you can ask them how come they're doing that, to put your mind at ease.

also ask for a tilt table test...there is a condition called POTS......I am not a dr, but a friend of mine has this and it sounds similar to the way u said u feel.....have u had any MRI's??ggreg is right that vitamin and mineral deficencies should be checked!Good luckGodspeed"selma"
